title: Waitsburg runner wins Pasco Invite
text: Print this article Advertisement PASCO — Waitsburg’s Emily Adams won the girls’ five-kilometer cross country race Saturday at the Pasco Invite, crossing the finish line in 19 minutes, 52.7 seconds. “Adams ran a smart, fast race,” Waitsburg coach Ann Adams said. “About two miles into the race she took off, leading the race by over 20 seconds at the finish.” Meanwhile, the Cardinals’ Landon Callas placed ninth in the boys’ race with his personal-best time of 17:47.2, and teammate Skylar Wood recorded his own top mark at 19:30.9, good enough for 24th place. “Big Cross is a tough course. Setting a personal best on that course is hard to do,” coach Adams said. Waitsburg’s Joe Leamy finished with a time of 22:45, Tom House soon followed with another personal record at 22:54. Koby Harris represented the Cardinals in the middle school division’s two-mile race, and he crossed the finish line in 15:48.6 and 12th place. The Cardinals next have a home meet Wednesday, and race again on Saturday at the Richland Invite. More like this story
